subject: Accounting

overview.description: Comprehensive accounting curriculum covering financial accounting principles, business transactions, financial statements, and accounting information systems for entrepreneurial ventures

learning_objectives: Master fundamental accounting principles and concepts
Understand double-entry bookkeeping and transaction recording
Prepare and analyze financial statements for business decisions
Apply accounting standards and regulations in Malaysian context
Utilize accounting software and digital tools for business management

units.title: Fundamental Accounting Principles
learning_outcomes: Understand the accounting equation and its applications
Understand the role of accounting in business decision-making

lessons.title: The Accounting Equation and Double-Entry System
objectives: Understand Assets = Liabilities + Owner's Equity
Apply double-entry bookkeeping principles
Record transactions using debits and credits

activities.description: Interactive demonstration of accounting equation with real business examples
Practice recording transactions using double-entry method
Work in teams to solve complex transaction scenarios
Quick quiz on accounting equation and double-entry principles

cross_curricular_connections: Mathematics: Number operations and equation solving
Business Studies: Business transactions and operations

lessons.title: Chart of Accounts and Journal Entries
objectives: Create and organize a chart of accounts
Prepare journal entries for various transactions
Understand the relationship between accounts and financial statements

activities.description: Classify different types of accounts and create chart of accounts
Practice writing journal entries for common business transactions
Identify and correct errors in journal entries
Discuss the importance of accurate record keeping

cross_curricular_connections: Information Technology: Database organization and structure
Business Studies: Business document flow and procedures

units.title: Financial Statements Preparation
learning_outcomes: Prepare trial balance and identify errors
Create income statement, balance sheet, and cash flow statement
Apply accounting adjustments and closing entries

lessons.title: Trial Balance and Adjusting Entries
objectives: Prepare trial balance from ledger accounts
Identify different types of adjusting entries
Apply accrual accounting principles

activities.description: Prepare trial balance from given ledger account balances
Identify and prepare various adjusting entries
Prepare adjusted trial balance after adjustments
Discuss the importance of adjusting entries in financial reporting

cross_curricular_connections: Business Studies: Business cycles and timing concepts

lessons.title: Income Statement and Balance Sheet Preparation
objectives: Prepare income statement showing revenues and expenses
Create balance sheet showing financial position
Understand the relationship between income statement and balance sheet

activities.description: Prepare income statement from adjusted trial balance
Prepare balance sheet showing assets, liabilities, and equity
Analyze relationships between the two financial statements
Present findings and key financial indicators

cross_curricular_connections: Economics: Business performance and financial health

units.title: Business Accounting Applications
learning_outcomes: Apply accounting principles to different business types
Understand inventory accounting and cost of goods sold
Master accounts receivable and payable management
Apply depreciation methods and fixed asset accounting

lessons.title: Inventory Accounting and Cost of Goods Sold
objectives: Understand different inventory costing methods (FIFO, LIFO, Average)
Calculate cost of goods sold for different business types
Apply perpetual and periodic inventory systems

activities.description: Compare FIFO, LIFO, and weighted average costing methods
Practice inventory calculations under different scenarios
Analyze perpetual vs periodic inventory system advantages
Apply learning to real business inventory scenarios

cross_curricular_connections: Business Studies: Inventory management and operations

lessons.title: Accounts Receivable and Credit Management
objectives: Understand credit sales and accounts receivable accounting
Apply bad debt estimation methods
Manage collection procedures and aging analysis

activities.description: Develop credit policies and terms for different business types
Calculate bad debt provisions using different estimation methods
Prepare accounts receivable aging analysis and collection strategies
Assess credit risk and collection effectiveness

cross_curricular_connections: Economics: Credit markets and risk management

units.title: Accounting Technology and Business Intelligence
learning_outcomes: Utilize accounting software for business transactions
Understand digital accounting and cloud-based systems
Apply data analysis techniques to accounting information
Develop financial dashboards and reporting systems

lessons.title: Accounting Software and Digital Systems
objectives: Navigate and use accounting software effectively
Set up chart of accounts and company information
Process transactions and generate reports electronically

activities.description: Set up new company file in accounting software
Enter various business transactions using software
Generate and customize financial reports
Evaluate benefits and limitations of accounting software

cross_curricular_connections: Information Technology: Database management and software applications
Business Studies: Digital transformation in business

lessons.title: Financial Data Analysis and Business Intelligence
objectives: Apply ratio analysis to financial statements
Create financial dashboards and visualizations
Interpret financial data for business decision making

activities.description: Calculate and interpret key financial ratios
Create interactive financial dashboards using spreadsheet tools
Analyze financial trends and prepare management reports
Make business recommendations based on financial analysis

cross_curricular_connections: Mathematics: Statistical analysis and data interpretation
Information Technology: Data visualization and dashboard design

core_exercises: Manual bookkeeping practice with real business scenarios
Financial statement preparation from trial balance
Accounting software operation and transaction processing
simulation_projects: Complete accounting cycle for a small business
Monthly financial statement preparation and analysis
real_world_applications: Financial statement analysis of public companies

textbooks: Principles of Accounting - Malaysian GAAP Edition
Financial Accounting for SMEs in Malaysia
software_and_technology: Accounting software (SQL Accounting, UBS, or similar)
supplementary_materials: Sample financial statements from public companies

industry_connections: Visits to accounting firms and corporate finance departments

cross_curricular_integration.mathematics: Mathematical calculations, ratios, and statistical analysis
cross_curricular_integration.economics: Financial markets, business cycles, and economic indicators
cross_curricular_integration.information_technology: Accounting software, databases, and digital literacy
